pull_request.title: Add keyword arguments in MessageAggregator.aggregate for Ruby 3.X
pull_request.body: This fixes #1465 Context: [Changes to the splat operator's behavior were introduced in Ruby 3](https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2019/12/12/separation-of-positional-and-keyword-arguments-in-ruby-3-0/) It passes the dummy "Replicate Crash" test case mentioned in the issue (not sure if I should add it in this PR as well):

repo.name: danger
repo.description: 🚫 Stop saying "you forgot to …" in code review (in Ruby)

issue.title: Crash in lib/danger/danger_core/message_aggregator.rb when using Ruby 3.1.4
issue.body:
# Report ## What did you do? Running danger (v8.4.2) in CI: ``` DANGER_MESSAGE_AGGREGATION=true \ DANGER_SUCCESS_MESSAGE="The post validation passed" \ bundle exec danger \ --fail-on-errors=true \ --dangerfile=$DANGER_POST_FILE \ --remove-previous-comments \ --danger_id="danger_post" | tee $DANGER_OUTPUT_FILE ``` ## What did you expect to happen? I expected danger to update the pull-request ## What happened instead? Danger crashes ``` /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/lib/danger/danger_core/message_aggregator.rb:11:in `initialize': wrong number of arguments (given 1, expected 0) (ArgumentError) from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/lib/danger/danger_core/message_aggregator.rb:8:in `new' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/lib/danger/danger_core/message_aggregator.rb:8:in `aggregate' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/lib/danger/danger_core/dangerfile.rb:259:in `post_results' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/lib/danger/danger_core/dangerfile.rb:292:in `run' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/lib/danger/danger_core/executor.rb:29:in `run' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/lib/danger/commands/runner.rb:73:in `run' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/claide-1.1.0/lib/claide/command.rb:334:in `run' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/danger-8.4.2/bin/danger:5:in `' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/bin/danger:25:in `load' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/bin/danger:25:in `' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/cli/exec.rb:63:in `load' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/cli/exec.rb:63:in `kernel_load' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/cli/exec.rb:28:in `run' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/cli.rb:494:in `exec' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/vendor/thor/lib/thor/command.rb:27:in `run' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/vendor/thor/lib/thor/invocation.rb:127:in `invoke_command' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/vendor/thor/lib/thor.rb:392:in `dispatch' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/cli.rb:30:in `dispatch' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/vendor/thor/lib/thor/base.rb:485:in `start' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/cli.rb:24:in `start' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/exe/bundle:49:in `block in ' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/lib/bundler/friendly_errors.rb:130:in `with_friendly_errors' from /opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/gems/bundler-2.2.12/exe/bundle:37:in `' from /opt/homebrew/opt/ruby@3.1/bin/bundle:25:in `load' from /opt/homebrew/opt/ruby@3.1/bin/bundle:25:in `
' ``` ## Your Environment * Which CI are you running on? Jenkins * Are you running the latest version of Danger? No, I'm running v8.4.2 but I can replicate it with the latest version * What is your Dangerfile? A generic simple dangerfile ## Comments I can replicate this by adding the following code snippet to `spec/lib/danger/danger_core/message_aggregator_spec.rb`: ``` context "Replicate crash" do it "should crash in ruby 3.X" do report = { warnings: [], errors: [], messages: [], markdowns: [], danger_id: "danger" } Danger::MessageAggregator.aggregate(**report) end end ``` Code copied from https://github.com/danger/danger/blob/d9fff7cbed6b0a4bfb6465709d0352e700bdd00e/lib/danger/danger_core/dangerfile.rb#L250C1-L259C101 Result:

issue.title: danger Action fails on POST
issue.body:
# Report

## What did you do?

Use the GH action thusly:

```yaml
  danger:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - uses: danger/danger@master
        env:
          DANGER_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

## What did you expect to happen?

It to work.

Note that if I do a "bundle exec danger" instead, it logs the problems to the log (but cannot write a comment to the PR), which is not optimal, but at least is useful. With the Action it just fails to run.

## What happened instead?

```
bundler: failed to load command: danger (/usr/local/bundle/bin/danger)
/usr/local/bundle/gems/octokit-7.2.0/lib/octokit/response/raise_error.rb:14:in `on_complete': POST https://api.github.com/repos/chef/chef/issues/13976/comments: 403 - Resource not accessible by integration // See: https://docs.github.com/rest/issues/comments#create-an-issue-comment (Octokit::Forbidden)
```

## Your Environment

* Which CI are you running on? GH Actions
* Are you running the latest version of Danger? Yes
* What is your Dangerfile?

```ruby
# Enforce our Gemfile update policy
if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile.lock')
  if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile')
    message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but it also updates Gemfile, so that" +
      " is probably OK - but the reviewer should check updates are soley" +
      " from the Gemfile update"
  elsif !github.pr_body.include?('--conservative')
    if github.pr_body.include?("#gemlock_major_upgrade")
      message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but output doesn't appear to be in" +
          " the PR Description. However #gemlock_major_upgrade does, so allowing"
    else
      failure "Gem/Bundle changes were not documented in the Description. If" +
        " this is a major update, add #gemlock_major_upgrade to the PR"
        " Description."
    end
  end
end
```

comment.body:
... there's no setup-ruby step required when using the built-in Action, it handles that itself. As I said, see:

https://github.com/danger/danger/blob/d9fff7cbed6b0a4bfb6465709d0352e700bdd00e/lib/danger/ci_source/github_actions.rb#L4

issue.title: danger Action fails on POST
issue.body:
# Report

## What did you do?

Use the GH action thusly:

```yaml
  danger:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - uses: danger/danger@master
        env:
          DANGER_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

## What did you expect to happen?

It to work.

Note that if I do a "bundle exec danger" instead, it logs the problems to the log (but cannot write a comment to the PR), which is not optimal, but at least is useful. With the Action it just fails to run.

## What happened instead?

```
bundler: failed to load command: danger (/usr/local/bundle/bin/danger)
/usr/local/bundle/gems/octokit-7.2.0/lib/octokit/response/raise_error.rb:14:in `on_complete': POST https://api.github.com/repos/chef/chef/issues/13976/comments: 403 - Resource not accessible by integration // See: https://docs.github.com/rest/issues/comments#create-an-issue-comment (Octokit::Forbidden)
```

## Your Environment

* Which CI are you running on? GH Actions
* Are you running the latest version of Danger? Yes
* What is your Dangerfile?

```ruby
# Enforce our Gemfile update policy
if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile.lock')
  if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile')
    message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but it also updates Gemfile, so that" +
      " is probably OK - but the reviewer should check updates are soley" +
      " from the Gemfile update"
  elsif !github.pr_body.include?('--conservative')
    if github.pr_body.include?("#gemlock_major_upgrade")
      message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but output doesn't appear to be in" +
          " the PR Description. However #gemlock_major_upgrade does, so allowing"
    else
      failure "Gem/Bundle changes were not documented in the Description. If" +
        " this is a major update, add #gemlock_major_upgrade to the PR"
        " Description."
    end
  end
end
```

comment.body: Ok! Got the same error and the above fix worked - perhaps it could give a clue anyway.

# Report

## What did you do?

Use the GH action thusly:

```yaml
  danger:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

      contents: read
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2

```

## What did you expect to happen?

It to work.

Note that if I do a "bundle exec danger" instead, it logs the problems to the log (but cannot write a comment to the PR), which is not optimal, but at least is useful. With the Action it just fails to run.

## What happened instead?

```
bundler: failed to load command: danger (/usr/local/bundle/bin/danger)
/usr/local/bundle/gems/octokit-7.2.0/lib/octokit/response/raise_error.rb:14:in `on_complete': POST https://api.github.com/repos/chef/chef/issues/13976/comments: 403 - Resource not accessible by integration // See: https://docs.github.com/rest/issues/comments#create-an-issue-comment (Octokit::Forbidden)
```

## Your Environment

* Which CI are you running on? GH Actions
* Are you running the latest version of Danger? Yes
* What is your Dangerfile?

```ruby
# Enforce our Gemfile update policy
if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile.lock')
  if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile')
    message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but it also updates Gemfile, so that" +
      " is probably OK - but the reviewer should check updates are soley" +

  elsif !github.pr_body.include?('--conservative')
    if github.pr_body.include?("#gemlock_major_upgrade")
      message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but output doesn't appear to be in" +
          " the PR Description. However #gemlock_major_upgrade does, so allowing"
```

comment.body: No, we are not (well, we don't specify, and my understanding is the default is `false`)

issue.title: danger Action fails on POST
issue.body:
# Report

## What did you do?

Use the GH action thusly:

```yaml
  danger:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - uses: danger/danger@master
        env:
          DANGER_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

## What did you expect to happen?

It to work.

Note that if I do a "bundle exec danger" instead, it logs the problems to the log (but cannot write a comment to the PR), which is not optimal, but at least is useful. With the Action it just fails to run.

## What happened instead?

```
bundler: failed to load command: danger (/usr/local/bundle/bin/danger)
/usr/local/bundle/gems/octokit-7.2.0/lib/octokit/response/raise_error.rb:14:in `on_complete': POST https://api.github.com/repos/chef/chef/issues/13976/comments: 403 - Resource not accessible by integration // See: https://docs.github.com/rest/issues/comments#create-an-issue-comment (Octokit::Forbidden)
```

## Your Environment

* Which CI are you running on? GH Actions
* Are you running the latest version of Danger? Yes
* What is your Dangerfile?

```ruby
# Enforce our Gemfile update policy
if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile.lock')
  if git.modified_files.include?('Gemfile')
    message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but it also updates Gemfile, so that" +
      " is probably OK - but the reviewer should check updates are soley" +
      " from the Gemfile update"
  elsif !github.pr_body.include?('--conservative')
    if github.pr_body.include?("#gemlock_major_upgrade")
      message "PR updates Gemfile.lock, but output doesn't appear to be in" +
          " the PR Description. However #gemlock_major_upgrade does, so allowing"
    else
      failure "Gem/Bundle changes were not documented in the Description. If" +
        " this is a major update, add #gemlock_major_upgrade to the PR"
        " Description."
    end
  end
end
```

comment.body: Are you using `bundler-cache: true` in your workflow? Try "clearing" the cache by setting/incrementing `cache-version`. See [setup-ruby: Dealing with a corrupted cache](https://github.com/ruby/setup-ruby#dealing-with-a-corrupted-cache).

issue.title: Bitbucket Cloud access token
issue.body:
Hey,

I cannot find how to use Bitbucket Cloud access token using danger (ruby). 
This is working fine with danger-js.

Is this not implemented here ?

Thanks for your help

issue.title: Danger fails on CI when running on PR from a fork in GH Actions / Buddy Build
issue.body:
We just set up danger in our repository and it fails when running on PRs from forks.

## What did you do?

```
bundle install  
bundle exec danger --fail-on-errors=true
```

## What did you expect to happen?

It would run danger and find the branch & commit in my fork.

## What happened instead?

It failed to find the commits and/or the branch:
```
fatal: Couldn't find remote ref refs/heads/event-ordering
fatal: Couldn't find remote ref refs/heads/event-ordering
fatal: Couldn't find remote ref refs/heads/event-ordering
fatal: Couldn't find remote ref refs/heads/event-ordering
bundler: failed to load command: danger (/usr/local/bin/danger)
RuntimeError: Commit c2b6bb0b doesn't exist. Are you running `danger local/pr` against the correct repository? Also this usually happens when you rebase/reset and force-pushed.
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/scm_source/git_repo.rb:111:in `raise_if_we_cannot_find_the_commit'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/scm_source/git_repo.rb:93:in `ensure_commitish_exists_on_branch!'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/request_sources/github/github.rb:112:in `setup_danger_branches'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/danger_core/environment_manager.rb:57:in `ensure_danger_branches_are_setup'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/danger_core/dangerfile.rb:259:in `setup_for_running'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/danger_core/dangerfile.rb:270:in `run'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/danger_core/executor.rb:29:in `run'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/lib/danger/commands/runner.rb:72:in `run'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/claide-1.0.2/lib/claide/command.rb:334:in `run'
/Library/Ruby/Gems/2.3.0/gems/danger-5.14.0/bin/danger:5:in `<top (required)>'
/usr/local/bin/danger:22:in `load'
/usr/local/bin/danger:22:in `<top (required)>'
```

## Your Environment

* Which CI are you running on? 
Buddybuild
* Are you running the latest version of Danger?
Yup
* What is your Dangerfile?
```
warn("PR is classed as Work in Progress") if github.pr_title.include? "[WIP]"

swiftlint.lint_files fail_on_error: true
```

comment.body:
> You could use `--fail-on-errors=true` to force an error code on the branched PR, though warnings would still slip by living only in logs


What? It works on branched repos, just not on forked repos. And it already fails on error, that's not the problem, the problem is it also fails for all PRs from forked repos because it can't find the commit making it seem like the author has bugs even when they don't. Hence the grepping the output above to decide what really happened.
